title: Ring of evasion
data:
***Version [0.30](/0.30 "0.30")**: This article **may not be** up to date for the [latest stable release](/0.32 "0.32") of Crawl.*

| Type | Jewellery                                                                             |
| :--- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| Name | Ring of evasion                                                                       |
| Icon | [![Ring of evasion.png](/images/8/87/Ring_of_evasion.png)](/File:Ring_of_evasion.png) |

|   |                                                                                                                       |
| - | --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
|   | A ring that makes its wearer either more or less capable of avoiding attacks, depending on its degree of enchantment. |

A **+5 ring of evasion** boosts the [evasion](/Evasion "Evasion") of its wearer.

## Desirability

All characters can benefit from more [EV](/EV "EV"), but sacrificing a ring slot for it may or may not be a good idea depending on your other resistances. Unlike most amulets, rings take effect immediately, so you can quickly switch between them at need.

Rings of evasion are more effective, on average, than a [ring of protection](/Ring_of_protection "Ring of protection"). However, [AC](/AC "AC") is more *reliable* than EV; with evasion, you either dodge or you don't. If you already have high AC, then a ring of evasion can be a good defensive choice (AC has a somewhat diminishing return, since it can't reduce attacks below 0)

A [ring of dexterity](/Ring_of_dexterity "Ring of dexterity") can end up providing more EV for characters with high [Dodging](/Dodging "Dodging") skill (among dexterity's [other benefits](/Dexterity "Dexterity")).

## History

- Prior to [0.30](/0.30 "0.30"), rings of evasion gave only +4 evasion.
- Prior to [0.27](/0.27 "0.27"), you could find rings of evasion with a -4 enchantment; such rings were always [cursed](/Curse "Curse").
- Prior to [0.25](/0.25 "0.25"), enchantments were random values between 1 and 6 (positive and negative).

| [Jewellery](/Jewellery "Jewellery") |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  |

| [Rings](/Ring "Ring")               | [Dexterity](/Ring_of_dexterity "Ring of dexterity") • [Evasion]() • [Fire](/Ring_of_fire "Ring of fire") • [Flight](/Ring_of_flight "Ring of flight") • [Ice](/Ring_of_ice "Ring of ice") • [Intelligence](/Ring_of_intelligence "Ring of intelligence") • [Magical power](/Ring_of_magical_power "Ring of magical power") • [Poison resistance](/Ring_of_poison_resistance "Ring of poison resistance") • [Positive energy](/Ring_of_positive_energy "Ring of positive energy") • [Protection](/Ring_of_protection "Ring of protection") • [Protection from cold](/Ring_of_protection_from_cold "Ring of protection from cold") • [Protection from fire](/Ring_of_protection_from_fire "Ring of protection from fire") • [Resist corrosion](/Ring_of_resist_corrosion "Ring of resist corrosion") • [See invisible](/Ring_of_see_invisible "Ring of see invisible") • [Slaying](/Ring_of_slaying "Ring of slaying") • [Strength](/Ring_of_strength "Ring of strength") • [Willpower](/Ring_of_willpower "Ring of willpower") • [Wizardry](/Ring_of_wizardry "Ring of wizardry") |
html:
Ring of evasion

From CrawlWiki
Jump to: navigation, search
Version 0.30: This article may not be up to date for the latest stable release of Crawl.
Type Jewellery
Name Ring of evasion
Icon
A ring that makes its wearer either more or less capable of avoiding attacks, depending on its degree of enchantment.

A +5 ring of evasion boosts the evasion of its wearer.

Desirability

All characters can benefit from more EV, but sacrificing a ring slot for it may or may not be a good idea depending on your other resistances. Unlike most amulets, rings take effect immediately, so you can quickly switch between them at need.

Rings of evasion are more effective, on average, than a ring of protection. However, AC is more reliable than EV; with evasion, you either dodge or you don't. If you already have high AC, then a ring of evasion can be a good defensive choice (AC has a somewhat diminishing return, since it can't reduce attacks below 0)

A ring of dexterity can end up providing more EV for characters with high Dodging skill (among dexterity's other benefits).

History

  • Prior to 0.30, rings of evasion gave only +4 evasion.
  • Prior to 0.27, you could find rings of evasion with a -4 enchantment; such rings were always cursed.
  • Prior to 0.25, enchantments were random values between 1 and 6 (positive and negative).
